R6 class activity creation

Source: R/activity.R
activity.Rd

Create R6 reference object class activity

Methods

Public methods

  • activity$new()

  • activity$clone()

Method new()

Initialize function for R6 activities class.

Usage

activity$new(
  trip_id,
  activity_id,
  ocean,
  activity_date,
  activity_number,
  activity_latitude,
  activity_longitude,
  set_count,
  school_type,
  activity_code,
  activity_name,
  time_at_sea
)

Arguments

trip_id

(character) Trip identification.

activity_id

(character) Activity identification.

ocean

(integer) Ocean identification.

activity_date

(date) Activity date in format year month day.

activity_number

(integer) Activity number.

activity_latitude

(numeric) Latitude, in decimal degree, of the activity.

activity_longitude

(numeric) Longitude, in decimal degree, of the activity.

set_count

(integer) Number of set associated to the activity.

school_type

(integer) School type identification.

activity_code

(integer) Activity code identification.

activity_name

(character) Activity identification.

time_at_sea

(integer) Time at sea in hours.

Method clone()

The objects of this class are cloneable with this method.

Usage

activity$clone(deep = FALSE)

Arguments

deep

Whether to make a deep clone.

Contents

Developed by Ob7 - Observatory of Exploited Tropical Pelagic Ecosystems, Mathieu Depetris, Antoine Duparc, Pascal Cauquil, Laurent Floc'h, Julien Lebranchu.
